intro: Paris delavayi var. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf Paris, is a rare and delicate herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest undergrowth. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
